question:
You have received a letter from your bank, asking you to acknowledge receipt of a new bank card. However, the card was missing from the envelope. Write a letter to the bank's head office. In your letter:

explain why you are writing
express concern about the missing card
ask them what they intend to do
Begin your letter as follows: Dear ____,

You should write at least 150 words.
text: I have been a loyal customer for six years and I am always gratitude your hard work. Unfortunately, I am writing this letter to express my concern regarding my missing credit card.

As you are aware, I was asked to send a receipt of my card but I have never received it. When I opened the envelope, I noticed that it was torn, and my new bank card, probably, has been stolen. My main concern is the pin code written on the card which can make my account accessible to others. Therefore, I would appreciate it if you could reissue my credit card ASAP. Additionally, please check my transactions history and notify me that how much money has been taken.
In order to prevent this type of issue in the future, I strongly recommend that your bank work with another post office which offers a secure service.
Should you require further information, do not hesitate to contact me.
